page.title: 14Folk Customs in Curry Rivel
page.content: Curry Rivel has some folk customs. Some are pretty old, some are not. The Christingle Service is at the church and it is a fairly new custom. It takes place in the month of December, on Christingle Day. You all have to make a 'Christingle'. A Christingle is an orange with a candle stuck in the top, then you put a red ribbon around it. Into this ribbon you place 4 cocktail sticks and onto these put currants, dates and pieces of dried fruit. The orange represents the world, the candle represents Christ - the light of the world, the red ribbon represents the blood that Jesus shed, and the dried fruit represents the fruit of the earth. During the Christingle service all the chidren who have made a 'Christingle' carry them up the central aisle to the main altar with the candles alight.
